docs.text:
Welcome to MkDocs


For full documentation visit 
mkdocs.org
.


Commands




mkdocs new [dir-name]
 - Create a new project.


mkdocs serve
 - Start the live-reloading docs server.


mkdocs build
 - Build the documentation site.


mkdocs help
 - Print this help message.




Project layout


mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name]  - Create a new project.  mkdocs serve  - Start the live-reloading docs server.  mkdocs build  - Build the documentation site.  mkdocs help  - Print this help message.
docs.title: Commands

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text:
Installation


Requirements




MongoDB server


NodeJS


Yarn package manager


(Optional) 
A swap file
 - reason being that 
Webpack uses loads of memory




Creating a MongoDB server


For simplicity, we're going to use 
mLab
 with the Free plan. Though it's recommended to [[setup your own MongoDB server|Development server]] if you plan to have a lot of traffic.




Head over to 
mLab and create an account
 (make sure to verify your email)


Click on 
Create new
 in the upper right corner


Select 
Sandbox
 and then click 
Continue




Select your preferred region and click 
Continue


Enter 
injectify
 as the database name, click 
Continue
 and then 
Submit order


Click on your new database and select 
Users
 and then 
Add database user




Choose a username and password and click 
Create
 (make sure 
read-only
 is left unchecked)




Creating a GitHub oauth application




Create a 
new GitHub application
 with the following values:










Field


Value










Application name


any






Homepage URL


any






Application description


any






Authorization callback URL


https://injectify.samdd.me










Setting up the server




Clone this repo


Copy 
server.config.example.js
 to 
server.config.js




Replace the GitHub 
client_id
 and 
client_secret
 values with your newly created applications ones.









Replace the 
mongodb
 value with your newly created mLab URL, in the format 
mongodb://<dbuser>:<dbpassword>@XXXX.mlab.com:XXXX/injectify
.









Run the following in a terminal at the root of the injectify repo:






sudo npm i -g yarn
yarn global add typescript
yarn global add pm2
yarn run install:all
yarn run deploy




Injectify will now be running over at 
http://localhost:3000
docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
Clone this repo  Copy  server.config.example.js  to  server.config.js   Replace the GitHub  client_id  and  client_secret  values with your newly created applications ones.     Replace the  mongodb  value with your newly created mLab URL, in the format  mongodb://<dbuser>:<dbpassword>@XXXX.mlab.com:XXXX/injectify .     Run the following in a terminal at the root of the injectify repo:    sudo npm i -g yarn
yarn global add typescript
yarn global add pm2
yarn run install:all
yarn run deploy  Injectify will now be running over at  http://localhost:3000
